text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Shanna Salazar,
and I am a Senior Executive Recruiter
supporting Amazon Web Services.
I've been at Amazon for 8 1/2 years,
and I've been with Amazon Web Services
for about 2 1/2 years.
During my career at Amazon,

I've had a range of
different opportunities.
The majority of time in recruiting,

but I've supported a number
of different divisions

that has included amazon.com
or the consumer side of Amazon.
I then was a program manager
for our Contingent Workforce program.
And then I joined Amazon Web Services
as an executive recruiter.

There's a seemingly endless
number of opportunities
just within this one company.
(upbeat music continues)

Some of the questions
that executives ask me

when I contact them about
opportunities with AWS

are most commonly what
opportunities are available?
What is the business doing?

Where does my background
fit within the organization?
What is the culture like?
What will it be like for me as a leader

to come into the organization,
to build relationships,
to get a seat at the table,

to have my voice be
heard to be able to drive
these big initiatives?
I'm talking to leaders who oftentimes
have a very established rapport
with the organization they're in,
and they want to know what it will be like
when they join AWS.

Will they be able to make
a big impact quickly?

We see our leaders, just
as we see our employees,
as owners in the company.

When they're coming in to
lead these big organizations,
they're truly the leaders in the business
that they're running.

And if you resonate with
our leadership principles,

which are such a
cornerstone of our culture,
that's a sign that you might enjoy
the type of work we're doing.

If you are inspired by
doing something unique
that hasn't been done before
and you consider yourself a builder,
this might be a great place to be.
(upbeat music continues)
